title: Noam Chomsky - 2007-05-XX - Philosophy, Politics, and Human Nature - Improved Sound
description:
Be sure to pick at least 720p for best sound quality.
In May of 2007, Noam Chomsky was interviewed by telephone on the radio program "Equal Time for Free Thought" - a WBAI radio program, in which he discusses Philosophy, Politics, and Human Nature. 

I combined two programs broadcast a few weeks apart into one audio file.  The source files were a pair of good quality (96/44) MP3s I've had on various hard drives for over 15 years.  I gave the audio a fairly thorough restoration: de-noising with digital noise reduction to remove a persistent hiss, some EQing to take out harshness, and went over it second by second to reduce or eliminate various audio flubs, etc.

To download a FLAC or MP3 version of this interview, visit the original Noam Chomsky Audio Conservatory on archive.org
